subtitle: This speedy moussaka develops an even tastier flavour if made a day in advance and left to stand in the fridge before reheating and serving.

method.text: Arrange the sliced aubergine in a single layer in a large shallow dish. Sprinkle over enough salt to just cover. Leave to stand for 30 min to draw out the bitter juices from the aubergine.
Meanwhile, place the butter in a microwaveable bowl. Cook on 50% MEDIUM power for 30 sec or until melted. Stir in the onion and garlic and cook on 100% FULL power for 2 min or until softened.
Stir in the flour then cook on 100% FULL power for 1 min. Add the tomatoes, tomato puree and mince to the bowl. Stir until well mixed. Cover and cook for 5 min on 100% FULL power.
Stir in the thyme and stock. Re-cover. Cook for 5 min on 100% FULL power, stirring halfway through cooking.
Rinse the aubergine thoroughly in cold water. Drain well. Spoon half the mince mixture into a microwaveable serving dish. Top with a layer of alternating slices of half of the vegetables.
Repeat the layers of meat and vegetables ending up with a final layer of alternating aubergine, tomato and courgette slices.

In a jug, beat together the yogurt, eggs, seasoning and nutmeg. Spoon over the layered vegetables finishing with a sprinkling of the cheese. Cook on 50% MEDIUM power for 10-15 min or until set around the edges.
Finish under the grill for a 1-2 min until golden.

title: Rich and tasty moussaka - MICROWAVE
